---
title: "Publishing Quarto with R, Python, and Julia"
description: "An example for a Quarto document that contains output from R, Python, and Julia code"
metadata:
  pagetitle: "Publishing Quarto with R, Python, and Julia"
author: "Christoph Scheuch"
date: "2024-01-11" 
image: thumbnail.png
image-alt: ... Created with DALL-E 3.
draft: true
---



`knitr` uses `reticulate` to execute Python code and `JuliaCall` to run Julia code...


Set-up:

- `renv` to manage R packages
- `renv` & `reticulate` to manage Python libraries
- use command line to initialize project to record / restore toml files



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Note that this code chunk is only required because of a bug with JuliaCall that prevents julia_setup() from finding the installation: https://github.com/quarto-dev/quarto-cli/issues/7055
JuliaCall::julia_setup("/Applications/Julia-1.9.app/Contents/Resources/julia/bin/")
```
:::



...

::: {.panel-tabset}
### R

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
library(palmerpenguins)

penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins

penguins
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 344 × 8
```

### Python

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins

penguins = load_penguins()

penguins
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
       species     island  bill_length_mm  ...  body_mass_g     sex  year
```

### Julia

::: {.cell}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using TidierData
using PalmerPenguins

penguins = DataFrame(PalmerPenguins.load())
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
